Reviews.Title: “Horrible Experience! Please Beware! The door was attacked with a knife! (photo attached)”
Reviews.Author: Fatma K
Reviews.Content: My husband booked this hotel based on good rating on booking.com, and when we arrived we discovered that they changed our reservation to the annex, and they told us they'd give us instead a good one on the canal (for which their geneorsity surprised us) which was a filthy apartment in a very very scary building, when we arrived there, i found the lamp in the living area was not working and it was almost hard to see eachother, when I asked the man who delivered us there about light, he told me why do you need light here? You will sleep there (referring to the bedroom), which was a very logic response! (lol) We decided that we will still take it and asked him to fix the light and after long negotations he did, after he left we were shocked to find that the apartment door was previously attacked with a knife or something! when we told the man to explain this he told us some people tried to open it but don't worry they did not succeed! It was totally unsafe that my husband was scared to leave me alone with our luggage till he went and tried to refund our money. They did not agree to refund us the money and we were charged the whole night price although we did not stay there.. ! don't ever try to go to this al gazzetino thing! p.s Photos of the broken door are attached.

Reviews.Title: “not the best but not too bad”
Reviews.Author: BartRusli
Reviews.Content: My wife and I absolutely loved Venice on our christmas 2012 trip... but the staff was unfriendly and unhelpful, the room was tiny and the tv is just like my pc monitor ...The only positive we have with regards to the hotel is the location;and outside of the hotel we very much enjoyed the city, and would most definately return to Venice and spend the extra money for a better hotel to improve the overall experience.

Reviews.Title: “You can find a much better place in the same area for the same budget”
Reviews.Author: mehilba
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very small. No Elevator . 13 rooms in 4 floors. Rooms are relatively small. Tiny Reception. Pretty expensive for its service. Receptionist was very unfriendly.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Al Nightmare (bait and switch!)”
Reviews.Author: Christine5450
Reviews.Content: It seemed like a planned bait and switch by the hotel. The reservation had been mismarked in the booking and they only had one of the two rooms requested. They said they only had one room for the two couples and "saved" us by showing us to an apartment down the way and they would have our rooms ready the next day. None of their promises were kept. We had to share a bathroom and sleep on a pull out sofa while the other couple had a full size bed. The breakfast consisted of meats, cheese, milk and yogurt that had not been on ice and was very warm and I thought unhealthy at that point, so a roll with jelly is what is left on the breakfast buffet. The canal is noisy in the AM. They have no elevator or AC, but they did have black mold and some sort of centipedes in the room. They had offered us a better price for our misunderstanding and then on check-out said there was no such arrangement and we had to argue for the corrected pricing. We heard other guests saying they had a similar problem and were checking out because the hotel had promised this elderly couple a first floor room, but put them on the fourth floor and she has a heart condition and can not walk stairs. Her 83 year old husband had to take the luggage up himself. We had a great time in Venice regardless, but I would say to never stay at this place!! I can give this hotel one good remark, the location. Other than that we had a nightmare experience.

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lesje45
Reviews.Content: I'll start with what I DID like: The room. We had three in our room and we had plenty of space. The air conditioning worked well. It was clean. What I DID NOT like: pretty much everything else. We were in the "annex" which was a three minute walk from the main hotel. There was not an elevator and we were on the top floor (4th or 5th floor). We had no help with our luggage. When I asked for an extra towel or two, I was asked "why?". The wi-fi rarely worked. We returned to our room one day and it was unlocked. Clean, but unlocked. The annex is not staffed except for the morning to mid-afternoon. If you would like a place close St. Marks, the Rialto Bridge....then the location is perfect. Other than that, I can't think of a reason to stay at Al Gazzettino.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for the money”
Reviews.Author: Lifeisgood68
Reviews.Content: Front desk staff welcome you with open arms. Had a room that was typical Venetian decor with a canal view. Great for people watching since the windows open in completely. Kids enjoyed looking at all the gondola traffic. Close the windows and the noise is gone. The beds are not comfortable so we rotated between sofabed, single and queen bed for 3 nights. Breakfast is included and very good if you like fresh meats, cheeses, rolls, yogurt and cereal for kids. Good location to walk either way to Rialto bridge or St Marks square. Complimentary water taxi to Island of Murano is a must! Sure it takes you to the most expensive gallery first but there's no obligation to buy anything. Tour the showroom and move on to lesser priced galleries. Overall, this is a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ClareTrev_11
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through booking.com. Before we left we phoned the hotel to confirm our stay is still OK as we were going somewhere else for a week first. The hotel said everything is fine and they were looking forward to our arrival. When we got there they had cancelled our room and sold it to someone else. This left us completely stuck and had to pay more for another hotel round the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, probably would not go back”
Reviews.Author: NVLC
Reviews.Content: This hotel had lovely rooms and a great location. Unfortunately when we arrived after a long haul with our bags we could not find anyone at reception and had to wait a long time for the attendant to turn up. Our room was on the third floor and looked down over the canal which was lovely and it was clean with good plumbing - not complaints there. However getting our bags up three floor was difficult. Plenty of great restaurants close by and all the great shops. Walk to the square and the Realto Bridge and water transport, all close by. If you arrive by train, the water taxi is just 2 stops from the Realto bridge which is the best stop to get off at to find the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great location, poor service/no AC. Restaurant next door is Great!”
Reviews.Author: psims2
Reviews.Content: The location is fantastic. Right in the heart of Venice on the canal. Near everything. However... and this was big to us, they put us in an apartment the owned on a 4th floor down the street, and the AC didnt work. Then when we asked them if they could at least give us a simple fan to cool us down, the mgr said 'what do you want me to do?' 'i dont own a fan and i cant call the owner or go buy one' Very disappointing service. I wouldn't go back. Turned out, the other guests staying there mentioned their AC didnt work either. The owner is letting the place go. Also the manager didnt speak English or French, so a guy from the restaurant next door spoke French, understood the situation and actually took one from his house and loaned it to us. Definitely give your business to the restaurant next door. Their food was fantastic & authentic. They are so nice too.

Reviews.Title: “Always waiting”
Reviews.Author: travelling255100
Reviews.Content: We read the reviews and when selecting the hotel it was recomended as a nice place in a good location. the location was excellent, but the hotel itself needs an overhaul. The toilet leeked around the base, the shower had tiles falling off it, the towels were dirty, and the reception staff were constantly outside on their mobile phones or no where to be seen. On check out day we had prior arranged (knowing that no body is ever there) to check out at 10am, on arriving at reception a 9.50am we waited for 45 minutes and no body arrived, the restaurant staff said to wait, well when you have a plane to catch that is not an option. finally after 55 minutes a staff member arrived with no apology. Breakfast is terrible when you advertise buffet thats what you expect, not rationed out crossiants and bread rolls. each person was entitled to 2 mini bread rolls and 1 crossiant and if you asked for more you were told NO!!! the other food to choose from was ham and cheese both sitting out all morning without ice or refrigeration. Milk and yogurt also sit out all morning. The breakfast room was also looked like a junk store. very average. The staff in the breakfast room is also the cleaner, so dont expect to get your bed made up before 4pm in the afternoon. Overall a very disappointing stay

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for seeing Venice”
Reviews.Author: JunoniaGirl
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at Al Gazzettino in May, 2011. The hotel is perfectly located to see St Marks Square and the Rialto Bridge. Our room overlooked a small canal that was busy from dawn to night time. It was noisy but that's the price you pay for being on the canal and well-located.The restaurant was great and the service from the staff (especially Daniel) was great!

Reviews.Title: “1 Star is about it”
Reviews.Author: Barbay
Reviews.Content: When we first ckd Trip Advisor about this hotel it was rated 3 Stars. I now see it has been accurately demoted to 1 Star. First, we had to wait 30 minutes for the reception desk to be manned, got to our room which overlooked boarded up windows, had poor A/C, hard bed, tiny shower with no wash cloths, when you sat on the commode your knees were in the bidet , a miniscule TV on top of amoire, dusty fabric upholstered walls which sent me into a sneezing fit, and a telephone which did not work. Nor did the corded pull in the shower which we yanked on several times thinking it was for a light, but turned out to be an ALARM notification for the staff,,,,none of which EVER appeared. All this for the budget price of 340 Euros. Do not book this hotel unles you have very low expectations and money to waste !

Reviews.Title: “we didnt end up staying in the main hotel but it was great”
Reviews.Author: kj12
Reviews.Content: First tip - it is hard to find the hotel unless you work out that the numbers on the tops of each of the stores and hotels are all in sequence - then you just follow the numbers and its easy. We arrived and had a thorough check in. We had booked a canal view room and it was in another building around the corner. It was in an old palace which had been conversted into apartments. The room we had was on the top floor and overlooked the canal with a balcony. It was decorated in traditional ventian style and it was lovely. The vide was a little sterile but honestly it was great. Its hard to to be well located on san marco so location was fine. Breakfast was included and it was ordinary but it really didnt matter. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Disappointing and Tatty”
Reviews.Author: arden4
Reviews.Content: Only stayed for 2 nights in room 105 but that was enough! 30 degree heat, Air-conditioning did not work and when we asked desk they said open a window. Bathroom very tatty, tiles cracked and coming off the wall, shower cubicle patched up with brown parcel tape. Toilet seat broken. Room was very dark and dingy and needed a light on all the time. Not a nice place to come back to relax before going out for the evening. Satelite TV had 200 channels all in Italian and although we didn't want to watch tv it's good to be able to see some news from home. Breakfast room was like sitting in a junk shop. All in all the facilities which the hotel says it offers do not actually exist and this is what we thought we were paying for. Venice is fantastic but stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: JSMMA
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the two bedroom apartment which was quite charming. It was a pleasant surprise since we did not expect such a big room. We were not located at the hotel itself so as opposed to other reviews, our bathroom was huge for European standards. Location was perfect and supplies were adequate. It even had a small kitchenette with cooking utensils! Only complaint was the absence of Wifi since we were not at the hotel building itself. Otherwise, I would definitely recommend this to other travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastico Venezia”
Reviews.Author: libemijoe
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location, great price, brilliant staff, room and service

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently Located, Friendly Accommodating Staff”
Reviews.Author: hifromsandiego
Reviews.Content: We booked this room for three nights 45 minutes from our arrival while at the train station on my Smartphone. The rates seemed reasonable and we were tired. Upon arrival, the staff was waiting for us (which was awesome!) and we were brought to our cozy room where we ditched our bags and got immediately out on the town. As it turns out we were right above the restaurant so when we got in at the end of the night we thought we were going to be up all night from the noise. Although we were conscious of the goings-on below us (really could only be heard out the window) it didn't keep us from sleeping and I am a LIGHT sleeper. Mind you this was in October and we had the window shut. Not sure in summer it would be so quiet from our room - 105. Our favorite things were that the breakfast was awesome, the staff was so helpful and kind and the location was amazing! Our least favorite was probably the shower size (small) and the location above the restaurant. Speaking of the restaurant, the food was great, the staff once again was amazing, and the home-spun authenticity feeling of the place was really quite nice. My only recommendation for the restaurant is that you need to be REALLLLLLY clear on what you order and to not eat ANYTHING that they bring to you that you didn't order, unless you are okay being charged for it. We didn't order the following and were charged for them since we consumed them when they brought them thinking that they might be being nice to us (only a few days before in Montelcino the waiter brought items to us and didn't charge us). Here are the items we didn't order: our appetizer, lemon liquor drinks, fried fish after our main course and two desserts. Why did we not complain? Well, we just had such a nice time trying these unusual fish items that we would never have tried otherwise and had such a nice experience (and my feet hurt less after all of the liquor) that we decided not to care. If you care then be sure to ask when these non-ordered items are brought to you. You should ask "is this complimentary?" (or whatever that is in Italian), or just refuse them all together. Overall, nice hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy Hotel, well located!”
Reviews.Author: Avid_traveller258
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at this hotel in beautiful Venice. The hotel is quite popular in Venice as it was a old Venetian Newspaper office! So most people still know it as that! The hotel is located in the heart of Venice, perfect to get around- eat, shop, party or even just stroll around. There is one restaurant attached to it and the guy who manages this(also owns the hotel), Ridha is simply amazing! He is the nicest man i met in Venice, so warm and looks after his both his hotel guests and restaurant goers who are not staying at the Hotel with an extra touch of warmth and generosity. He pampered us with a load of complimentary desserts and lemon cellos n grappas until you could have no more! The hotel itself, yes does have small rooms- but lets not forget we are in Venice here where you don't see any buildings using large spaces. We stayed in their normal double rooms which was just fine for the two of us. The bath in particularly can be too small, especially if you are a tall/big person! The hotel is cleaned every day and well maintained. Beware that there are no lifts in this hotel, which is the only drawback. However i hear that most old buildings in Venice don't have elevators. The hotel reception staff however are very courteous and helpful and even helped us carry our luggage up when we arrived and checked out too! I read a review where someone mentioned that it was a scam about the free trip to Murano and the casino and I have to strongly disagree! Remember you are not in a 5 star where there are a 100 staff serving you! This is a small hotel and has limited staff. We had this as a part of our hotel deal and when we arrived checked about this. They very happily arranged for these and we did go both to the Murano Glass Factory and Casino, which was very good! If you are looking for a cozy, centrally located hotel with courteous staff, you will not regret this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Just OK - big room and tiny bathroom - Not recommended”
Reviews.Author: spf1268
Reviews.Content: Nice large room, with canal view and small balcony. You get some noise from passing boats, but that is to be expected. Very small and outdated bathroom and shower, and a constantly dripping faucet. No elevator, so be prepared for climbing some steps. Breakfast in the adjoining restaurant was good, but don't plan on having lunch or dinner there - too pricey and not very good quality. The room had a constant dampness and mildew smell. Had free internet, but no Sky TV or english language TV channels. In the end, we cannot recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “What a perfect representation of Venice!”
Reviews.Author: sandyfromgreece
Reviews.Content: This hotel was all we were led to believe it was according the the reviews I read. The front desk personnel were so genuinely helpful and kind. The room was as small as most European Hotel rooms, but laid out beautifully and comfortably. The view outside the window was one I've never experienced before - overlooking the canal with a gondola parked right below us. We were very happy with the location, the cleanliness, the breakfast that was included and the whole atmosphere of the hotel. It would be worth a return visit!

Reviews.Title: “Nice location. No service!”
Reviews.Author: LENNY
Reviews.Content: Nice location. No service!

Reviews.Title: “A Gem in the heart of Venice”
Reviews.Author: robmazz
Reviews.Content: This hotel owned by the DePaolis brothers is a real gem. I have been going to Venice for about 40 years now and have always stayed in the Cannareggio area. This time around because we were travelling with our children we decided to stay at the Al Gazzettino. We were not disappointed. The location is ideal as it is minutes from the Ponte Rialto and the Piazza San Marco with some of the best shopping located around the hotel. The hotel is housed in a very old building but you would not know this unless told. The rooms are furnished in a typical venetian manner which only adds to the charm of the hotel. Our room overlooked the canal behind the hotel and we have many pictures of the numerous gondolas which passed by our window. I came to know Andrea DePaolis fairly well and have to say that he is an impressive young man. I spoke to his brother Antonio( I believe) on a few occasions and found him also very helpful and accomodating. Breakfast was good and we were looked after by caring staff members. I plan to be in Venice later this year and will repeat at this hotel. I wish the DePaolis brothers continued success with this hotel. A special thanks to Daniele (who was present for the first two days of our stay) for all his help and fellowship. I would strongly recommend that you consider a stay at this hotel if you are planning to go to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and location for sightseeing BUT BEWARE not helpful !”
Reviews.Author: DaviesBristol
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights mid July before a great cruise. Very good, spacious quadruple room for 2 adults (double) and 2 teenage daugters (2 singles). Air con struggled but non the less a pleasant stay with good buffet breakfast. Expensive for what it was. Location great for sightseeing (between Rialto and St Marks). When we left for cruise on Sat am 10 July, with 17 July return and late pm flight back to London. We asked recptionist if we could leave our luggage safe for a few hours on the return Saturday whilst walking around Venice (definately not practical to drag cases around !). We were greeetly with a very friendly 'no problem, that will be fine'. On our return however the (different receptionist, claiming to be the owner) was very 'off' and would not entertain our request even though it had been ok'd the previous week. He insisted that our only option was to leave our bags at the trian station, a water taxi ride away taking some 30 / 45 minutes back to near the port where we'd just come from !! All in 35 degree heat. Therefore ... beware .. don't use this hotel if you have time to kill on the day of check-out .... You will be forced to carry all your luggage with you...something other hotels would be pleased to help with !! The Davies family, Bristol, England

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel great location”
Reviews.Author: wfredflw
Reviews.Content: Our family (my wife and I, two children 14&11, and my mother 74) stayed in one room at the hotel for one night. The room has a great with a view of a canal and footbridge. We had ample room even with four beds and all our luggage. The hotel staff were very nice and assisted us with directions, a map, and plenty of suggestions. The hotel is located right along the main trail from Saint Mark's to the Rialto bridge. Utilizing the water buses instead of the taxis was so easy saving us lots of money. You can be at either St. Marks or the Rialto with a five minute walk. The breakfast was nice with fresh breads and coldcuts. The owner set it up early since we were leaving early to catch a train. We ate dinner at the restuarant which was very good, however a bit pricy. Everything was just as described and I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Charming”
Reviews.Author: LucyGus
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Gazzettino is in a perfect location, right between the Rialto Bridge (and water taxis) and San Marco Square. Very good breakfast in the quirky little restaurant. We had dinner at the restaurant and it was quite good. Room was beautifully decorated and had a wonderful little balcony overlooking a small canal. Nice bathroom but mildew in the shower. The mattress on our bed could use an updating. We loved the hotel and Daniel, the hotelier, could not have been more helpful. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Enchanting hotel in a super location”
Reviews.Author: LimaMonaghan
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a superb location, just a couple of minutes from Rialto Bridge and only a couple of minutes walk to Piazza San Marco. The double room was spotless, warm and spacious, with a large bathroom. The staff are very friendly and helpful and our room was cleaned each day of our visit. It is a small hotel and very peaceful at night. We would definitely stay at this hotel if we ever returned to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Best location and price”
Reviews.Author: Bellaura
Reviews.Content: The room was large with a private bathroom and air conditioner. It was in a great location, was inexpensive, and provided a basic breakfast. The staff was helpful and courteous. There is a good amount of better places out there, but at the time I wanted something clean, centrally located, and inexpensive. This place met those expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Warm hospitable hotel worth repeating”
Reviews.Author: milanaangelo
Reviews.Content: Nice and very centrall place where to stay. Sotlessly clean and spacious rooms. The english speaking front desk staff was most helpful and welcoming. An experience to repeat and recommend to everybody who wants to visit the magic Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, charming view of small canal and gondolas, large comfortable room for family of four in small hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ChloeAnn
Reviews.Content: I requested a lovely, spacious room for a family of four with daughters, after selecting this hotel for the look of the rooms in pictures. I believe that my request was honored and we had the best room in the hotel! The bathroom was huge with 2 sinks and large mirrors. The room had a door that opened onto a small balcony overlooking a canal with gondolas and a view of the surrounding buildings & shops with a pedestrian walkway and bridge. A lovely continental breakfast was included. It was a short walk to the Grand Canal, Rialto Bridge, and St Mark's Square.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: Familyof5help
Reviews.Content: This is a good no-frills, mid-range hotel. Rooms are relatively small but clean and nicely decorated. Bathroom was large and clean except for mould in shower. Staff helpful and pleasant. Breakfast was disappointing, but adequate. Restaurant did not look very appealing for lunch or dinner. Good location near Rialto Bridge and not far from San Marco. Our room had a small balcony from which we could watch the gondoliers cruising by.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent Venice, Like a Fairytale! Breathtaking”
Reviews.Author: Alison G
Reviews.Content: My husband and i have just returned from a long weekend in Venice. We travelled from Shannon with Ryanair and flew into Treviso airport just outside Venice. The transfers were smooth and effortless, We caught the Airport shuttle which leaves after each ryanair flight arrival and got off at the last stop which was Pizzale Roma Bus Terminal, it was then just a short walk accross the bus park to catch the No 2 Vaparetto { water bus in italian} down the grand Canal to the Rialto Bridge.Bus and Vaparetto tickets can be purchased in advance in the arrival hall at the airport, we purchased 36 hour vaparetto tickets which mean you can take as my trips on the water bus as you like, they cost 18 euro each which is brillant as 1 single trip costs 10 euro! Print the map from the hotels website and you will find the hotel without any problems, like we did. We were very hungry as we had a 0400am start for the airport and arrived at the Rialto Bridge approx 1100am, we deceided to have lunch, which was very reasonable a large Slice of Veggie Pizza, a bottle of cold water and a Yummy Lemon Italian Gelato {Shave Ice} for less than 10 euro each! It takes less than 5 mins to walk to hotel from the Rialto Bridge and we found it without any problems, We were checked in straight away and show to our room by the friendly staff, We had the blue and gold room and it is exactly as pictured on the website. Our windows had old fashioned wooden shutters and the view of the canal below with gondala's and singing gondaliers was breath taking! The bed was very comfy and we slept for 2 hours that afternoon before heading off and taking in the sights of Venice. The streets of venice in July were buzzing with tourists,{which normally i do not like!} but it didnt bother me it really added to the venetian experiance. Its was very warm 30 degrees, and every took advantage by sitting along the river in San Marco having there picnic lunch or Gelato to cool down. You cannot visit venice and not take a Gondala ride, although they are very expensive at 80 euro for a 20 min ride, they are actually worth every penny. We both thoroughly enjoyed the experiance! We boarded our gondala just outside our hotel, the gondalier is actually sort of a tour guide and filled us in on the history of Venice, showing us the home of famous venetian residents from the past like Casanova and Marco Polo, and famous buildings before bringing us down the grand Canal and back to our hotel. The streets around the hotel are very reasonable and have 3 couse options for 18-20 euro per person which again for venice is very reasonable. Any one taking a long break in Venice and wanting to get out of the city should visit the Lido, its a Vaparetto ride from the Rialto bridge and in approx 45 mins can have you at the beach, which wasnt crowded at all, you can also hire wooden beach huts, loungers and umbrellas. Its worth it for the ferry ride alone, its breathtaking on the journey back to venice. Overall i would rate venice as a must see, i have been put off the past by people saying its expensive, smelly and dirty! I can assure you it is none of that, its water was a beautiful blueish green colour and even though the weather was really hot, there was no sewerage smell anywhere in the city, i would be the first to say if it stunk! Meals are reasonable and so are drinks most place's. If you are eating at Hotel Danieli terrace or Cafe Florian in San Marco, they are obviously not cheap based on there locations and views. Dont miss having a "Bellini" in venice its a mixture of Peach juice and champagne and was invented in Harry Bar { vaparetto stop San Marco}. Its yummy! Just go, you will have a wonderful time. I actually had to rub my eyes, upon first sight of beautiful venice from the vaparetto on the grand canal, i though i was dreaming. It is just like being in a fairytale!

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms, Friendly Staff, and Superb Location!”
Reviews.Author: orlandohelper
Reviews.Content: I had the opportunity of staying at this nice small hotel with a group of friends as a weekend getaway during our Italian vacation in Tuscany. I would strongly recommend a superior room with canal view, the room was very clean, beds comfortable, nice furnishings, and a spacious bathroom nearly the size of the room itself, a feature usually not found in most European hotels. Staff was also very friendly, the gentlemen at the Front Desk were always friendly and helpful with requests and questions, the hotel appears to be run by a family giving it a nice touch. The location is also unbeatable, right smack in the middle of San Marco, a minutes walk away from both the Rialto bridge and the world famous St. Marks Square. The only minor downside is the tiny lobby and noisy gondoliers in the canal below in the morning, however it was always quiet at night in time for sleep, no biggie. Venice is by far one of the most beautiful cities I have ever experienced and this hotel just makes everything better.

Reviews.Title: “Good room for family. Staff superb, good food.”
Reviews.Author: Eileen62
Reviews.Content: My family of 5 stayed here and were overall very happy. Staff is WONDERFUL -- so helpful and just really nice people! Room was spacious and clean -- we had 1 queen and 2 singles and one single/sofa bed -- all comfortable. Bathroom was spotless EXCEPT for the shower - mold in grout. Odd, because everything else was SPOTLESS. A bit noisy until about midnight because its on a canal and you could hear a restaurant, but I suspect most hotels on canals experience this. Our windows opened up onto a canal, so each morning we'd see the gondolas going by - beautiful. The morning breakfast was great -- good food, coffee. Location was fantastic!!!! While hotel seems a little dated, overall it was a great deal for my family of 5.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, not great, but not bad”
Reviews.Author: antacids
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property one night as party of a quick run up to Venice. Very nice staff who showed us to small, but nice room over looking one of the canals. We we four in the room (they have a pull out sofa that converts into 2 beds) so it was a bit cramped. For 2 people the room would have be good. Location is very good with easy access to restaurant, shopping and the water taxi. Place is clean and Wi-Fi worked well in the room. I would recommend this property for a younger couple looking for a decent place at a reasonable price in this otherwise outrageously priced city.

Reviews.Title: “Gem of a hotel so close to the sights”
Reviews.Author: Mcsquane
Reviews.Content: I've just got back from staying a few days in Venice - and agree with every positive comment made about the Hotel Al Gazzettino. The hotel is a 5 minute walk from the Rialto water bus stop. There is a great ATVC service from the airport that costs 12 euros, which makes about 2 stops before Rialto. The service back to the airport leaves 3 minutes pass the hour until 4pm. (Check the timetable, if not frequent Aqualina ferries run to and from San Macro and the airport). The staff are friendly and helpful. (The warnings on when the high tides were due were very welcome). The room was a good size and well maintained. Breakfast comprised of pastries, cereal, juice and freshly brewed coffee. The hotel is well-located. St Marks Square is a 5 minutes away with the Basilica di San Marco and Palazzo Ducale, then stop for a bellini at Harry's Bar or a coffee on the square. (Caffe Florian closed till Dec 18th, if memory serves me correctly). If you cross the Rialto Bridge and you can be at the Accademia Gallery or the excellent Peggy Guggenheim Collection in 10 minutes. Another art gallery definitely worth a visit is Palazzo Grassi. You can easily walk there in 10 minutes from the hotel, or just hop on a water bus and get off at San Samuele. The Italics exhibition was on while I visited (and runs till March 2009) that covers Italian art since 1968. So good.

Reviews.Title: “Such a charming place, the Trattoria has great food,”
Reviews.Author: CiaoBigsy
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a place midway between the rialto and piazza san marco, this is it! very convenient for a stay especially if you are fond of the night walks through the twisted streets. the rooms were just charming.. a cross between a venetian palace and a venetian brothel... on the other hand the trattoria downstairs is my most favorite place to eat in venice, from the decor to the venitian newspaper lined tables..throw out the menu and ask for whatever the chefs special is.. it cost us $30 euro per person ( we were 5 ) but it was well worth it!, seafood salad, daily pasta, pumpkin saffron rissotto, fresh carpaccio of sea bream, and then grilled fresh fish with lemon and basil on fruity olive oil, complete with salad ,bread and a wonderous dessert and wine.. the best part of it was the crazy all in one host/waiter.. you wont regret staying here or even just eating here..

Reviews.Title: “location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: ksugroup
Reviews.Content: This hotel could not have been in a better location situated between the Rialto and San Marco. Very convenient for sightseeing and shopping. The hotel is small, but the staff are great and the rooms are colorful. We loved the rooms on the canal!

Reviews.Title: “great location- good hotel”
Reviews.Author: erin2426
Reviews.Content: tJust got back from a 4 night stay .This hotel was a great find- especially as its so central to everything in venice.5 mins oTORialto and 3-5 mins ot St Marks.Hotel was clean and very welcoming.Room was decorated in venetian style red and gold and was a good size.Breakfast was a buffet of croissants and bread rolls with jams and speads and butter provided-also yougurt and juice.Baskets of a selection of crackers o nthe table and coffee was served fresh to order .Everyone at the hotel was lovely-very polite and helpful.This is a gem of a hotel and will be returning to stay here .

Reviews.Title: “Location is great, but...”
Reviews.Author: JayhawkIke
Reviews.Content: The Good: As others have mentioned, the location is great. It's a 5 minute walk from the Rialto Bridge (and the closest vaporetto stop) from the north and 3 minutes to San Marco to the south, although the first time finding it was impossible until a fine, friendly local gentleman pointed us in the right direction. There is also great shopping (my wife found that) and dining very close by. The younger man (owner's son?) who was there during the day was helpful, and spoke pretty good broken English. Our room overlooked a canal, and had a balcony that you could go out on. The Bad: OK, I saw this was rated one star by the "experts" but fared much better with the users here, so that made my decision to try it. While I think the hotel deserves more than one star, there were some problems. First, the upkeep isn't so good, as evidenced by dirty-looking floor tile, a cracked shower head, mis-matching lightbulbs in outdated glass fixtures in the bathroom, a non-working remote control for the (I kid you not) 13 inch TV that was mounted near the ceiling ( a 12 foot ceiling), etc. Oh, and one final bad thing - we returned at 10:45 from grabbing breakfast on the date of checkout, and found an irate owner (not very personable) yelling at us that checkout was 10:30 and we needed to get out as there was someone waiting for the room. Problem was, no one told us of this oddly early checkout time, so it was a little nervy of him to take that tact with us. Still, they stowed our luggage for the rest of the day until we needed to depart, so other than his abrasiveness, didn't cause much of a problem. Now, I'm not one to sink a hotel because of the TV (this WAS a vacation, after all) or an owner who was rude to us, but I think realistically this hotel should rate a 2-star rating, and possibly a 2+ or 3- because of its location.

Reviews.Title: “Clean room, great location”
Reviews.Author: MistaMusc
Reviews.Content: Al Gazzettino turned out to be a great find. It's main attraction is the location, it could not be better located equally between the Rialto Bridge and St. Mark's Square. Its in the heart of the centre and our room looked down onto a canal. Compared to other hotels I priced in Venice I was worried that this would be a dive, but the staff we friendly and the room was very clean. Our family stayed in a quadruple room, which consisted of a double bed, single bed and a fold out couch, and served its purpose as we were out sightseeing most of the time anyway. The downsides are that the hotel has no elevator, but we were on the first floor so that didn't prove too bad for us. Also the breakfast is not great. A croissant is layed out for you on a plate, and they offer you one glass of juice and a coffee. And we also had some trouble with the hot water, sometimes having to leave the shower running for up to 15 minutes before it was hot.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Al Gazzettino
HotelInfo.Address: San Marco 4971, 30124 Venice, Italy
